channel.title: Paying 10 bucks for a tiny bit of help!
channel.description: Ok, this is my problem: When I download a source/client I first check to make sure I can login with 127.0.0.1 (localhost) then I change it to my no-ip.com address and it will not connect. I have port-fowarded and everything. I had a server on my desktop but it crashed so now i'm stuck with my laptop! :( Well, if you know why post in comments and leave your paypal address in there also, I will send you 10.00$USD if your answer corrects my problem! And you will also be one of my admins in-game! First correct answer gets it so hurry!

item.title: Paying 10 bucks for a tiny bit of help!
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I meant dynamic address, not ip.

I was typing ‘IP’ too many times. Ha.

/facepalm.

As for the hosting connection, it rejects all connections from out side addresses. (most of the time)[/quote]
Haha yea that happens to me a lot.

Oh, mine always used to let me sign in with whatever address I wanted. Although I did always have my firewalls and stuff disabled. So maybe that’s why.

Read full topic
item.source: Paying 10 bucks for a tiny bit of help!

item.title: Paying 10 bucks for a tiny bit of help!
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]The hoster must always use a local address.
Anyone else connected to your network, should use the IPv4 address.
All other people must use your static IP or your dynamic IP.[/quote]

Nuh uh.

The hoster can use what ever they feel like.
The person on the same network can use; Dynamic DNS, Dynamic IP and Static IP.
All other people can use exactly the same as the person on the same network, apart from the Dynamic IP.

I Vain I:

For your dynamic IP, please refer to http://no-ip.com/

That isn’t a Dynamic IP. It’s a Dynamic DNS.

For your Dynamic IP address use;

Start -> Run -> cmd -> ipconfig. (Windows)
Applications -> Accessories -> Terminal -> ifconfig (Linux)

Read full topic
item.source: Paying 10 bucks for a tiny bit of help!

item.title: Paying 10 bucks for a tiny bit of help!
item.dc:creator: @julie101 julie101
item.description:
@julie101 wrote:

[quote=“Rocky2k10, post:12, topic:361294”]you cannot log into you no-ip only other players that want to play your private server have to use that ip not you…

you should stay at 127.0.0.1[/quote]
I actually got it to work! Thanks for all your help

Read full topic

item.title: Paying 10 bucks for a tiny bit of help!
item.dc:creator: @julie101 julie101
item.description:
@julie101 wrote:

[quote author=RuneSpace link=topic=457577.msg3348943#msg3348943 date=1285096165]
Heres a few things to check

  1. Make sure another process isnt occupying 43594
  2. Your no-ip is configuired properly
  3. Make sure theres an exception for the port in your firewall
    Just a suggestion, try opening 5555 and running your server off that?

Take a screenshot of your client i want to see it
You seem to know what your doing can you just teamview me? add my msn: dildowillis@hotmail.com

Read full topic

item.title: Paying 10 bucks for a tiny bit of help!
item.dc:creator: @julie101 julie101
item.description:
@julie101 wrote:

[quote=“RuneSpace, post:6, topic:361299”][quote author=pinhead936 link=topic=457577.msg3348758#msg3348758 date=1285056302]
You Can’t Connect to your server if you are hosting with your no-ip. You HAVE to use a Static… Only other players use your no-ip…
[/quote]

Lol?

I can connect to my server using my no-ip, You my friend are FOS

Before you try to look smart, get some rep nub lol[/quote]

Ya, I used Exionpk.no-ip.biz and i could login just fine with my desktop. And what is static? lol.
